intro: Eriophorum × medium subsp. album, commonly known as the white cottongrass, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a hybrid species within the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its fluffy, white inflorescences that resemble cotton. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-poor habitats such as bogs and wet meadows. Its leaves are grass-like and often covered in fine, silky hairs. The species plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
